page.title: 03Harbour Hill
page.content: The area around{Harbour Hill}is rolling countryside on the easten side of Strinesdale Valley.The land rises to almost{400 metres}above sea level with two small streams runing down to the valley bottom. The area is mainly covered in fields of grass used for{grazing}and horses animals such as sheep cattle. The fields are divided by{dry_stone { walls}which have been blackened by years of pollution. There are several{farms and { cottages}in the area some of which have had the stone work cleaned to its natural colour.Some of the farms were neat and tidy but others had a very 'tatty', run down appearance. The{roads}are narrow winding country lanes with stone walls along the sides and cottages. The area is very quiet and
